summary: Discovering the MCU: Phase 1 It is time to tell you my darkest, most shameful secret. Are you ready? Well here it is: Until...
caption:
Discovering the MCU: Phase 1

It is time to tell you my darkest, most shameful secret. Are you ready? Well here it is:

Until recently, I had never watched a single Marvel movie.

Okay, that’s a lie. But only slightly. Last year I watched Spiderman: Homecoming. But yeah, that was the only one I had ever watched.

I have always been a bit behind when it comes to pop culture. Okay, a lot behind. Like, I didn’t read the Harry Potter books until 2016. Yeah, I know.

In regards to Marvel, I was kind of just oblivious to their existence for I long time. I mean, I knew what they were, but I really didn’t pay any attention to them.

Then, about a year ago, I started working in a movie theater. Every one of my co-workers are movie nerds, and of course, that means Marvel nerds. Hearing everyone talk about them,  watching them go out of their minds about Infinity War, and then Endgame, I realized that I really wanted to know what this was all about. I didn’t want to be left out of the hype anymore.

But it seemed like a bit of a daunting task, to be honest. I mean, there are 22 movies in the MCU now. So I kept on putting it off. But then, a couple of weeks ago, I bought ‘Iron Man’ in a charity shop. And so now I am, finally, on my way to watching the Marvel movies.

Last night, I finished Phase 1. For some reason, it did not occur to me to blog about this until now, but better late than never, right? So here I am going to write a short review about my impression of each movie so far. Then, from now one, I shall write a post for each movie as I watch it. So, if you are interested to read the thoughts of someone experiencing the MCU for the first time, then stick around!

Iron Man – As the very first film in this epic franchise, ‘Iron Man’ was perfect to convince me to keep going. Tony Stark is a fantastic character, and his origin story is fun, captivating and exactly what I would want from a superhero movie.

The Incredible Hulk – My main impression of this film was that the CGI was very impressive for 2008. It is a decent movie, and I enjoyed it, but I can see why it is one of the lowest rated movies in the MCU. I found myself mocking the movie numerous times as I watched it.

Iron Man 2 – I liked this movie more than ‘The Incredible Hulk’, but not as much as the first ‘Iron Man’. My main problem with it was that the villain had such a heavy accent… Maybe I am just a stupid American, but I get so confused when important plot points are narrated by a character with a thick accent.😂 I really enjoyed it anyway, though.

Thor – Another enjoyable movie. I like the fact that the magical elements of ‘Thor’ feel like a change from the sci-fi origins of Iron Man and the Hulk. Thor and Loki, in fact all of the characters from Asgard, are very enjoyable characters, but I found the humans, particularly Jane, a bit dull.

Captain America: The First Avenger – This one is damn good. Who doesn’t love a good underdog story? I really like the fight scenes in this one – I think it is Steve’s shield, it is just kind of awesome.

The Avengers (or the Avengers Assemble) – 100% my favorite so far. Damn, I really loved this. I found myself super invested in it. I think it was mainly the character interaction, but there were other things as well… The fight scenes, the story itself, having Loki back as the villain, and just having all the different characters together made it much more interesting and exciting.👌🏻

Well, that’s all for now! If you can’t already tell, I am quickly becoming a Marvel fan.😄 I’m not surprised… I mean, I knew there had to be a reason that this is the biggest franchise in the world! Can you believe that Endgame has already made $2 billion at the box office??

I am planning on watching ‘Iron Man 3’ very soon, so stay tuned!😉

[By the way, just to be clear, I am watching the movies in order of release, not in chronological order]

body:
The Marvel MCU

Is literally filled with inspirations for people of all types. Actors and characters. They’re not perfect but as someone struggling with a lot of mental stuff, Marvel alone has helped so much by just illustrating so beautifully the power of determination and love between friends. I hope others can find inspiration in them as well <3

I DO NOT rp any innapropriate content with minors and I'll REPORT anyone I see doing so. No profit, just for fun. Follow me on Twitter @drstrangefanask

summary: No, because the world needs me. I know it sounds arrogant...but it’s true. And...I would be lying as hell if I said I don’t like...
body:
No, because the world needs me. I know it sounds arrogant…but it’s true.
And…I would be lying as hell if I said I don’t like this job.

I finally found my objective, my reason to be, and that feels great.

blog.name: tigerlover16-uk
blog.title: Tiger Lover 16-UK
blog.description: Jack Humphreys, Age 24, From Wales. I'm a Christian, animal lover, an animation fan and a gigantic nerd. Fan of Spider-man, Dragon Ball, DC and Marvel Comics, MLP, Harry Potter and a variety of other shows, movies, comics and books. I'm just here to have fun, do some good and talk about the things i like (And sometimes the stuff I don't).

summary: Okay, I was expecting Avengers Endgame to pass $2 billion at the box office today, but I didn’t think it was going to shoot past...
body:
Okay, I was expecting Avengers Endgame to pass $2 billion at the box office today, but I didn’t think it was going to shoot past Titanic. It’s not even passed it’s second weekend, and this thing is already the second highest grossing movie of all time. Dang.

Watch out Avatar, you’re about to be dethroned.

Watch out Avatar, you’re about to be dethroned.

summary: Next potential MCU big bad: Kang the Conqueror (Part 1) WARNING: Some major Endgame spoilers ahead!  With Avengers: Endgame...
body:
Next potential MCU big bad: Kang the Conqueror (Part 1)

WARNING: Some major Endgame spoilers ahead!

With Avengers: Endgame having been released, the movie draws the Infinity Saga to its conclusion in a fantastic close to the overarching storyline with the defeat of Thanos. Even though we know right now that Phase 3 officially ends with the release of Spider-Man: Far From Home this coming July, the questions on everyone’s minds are: What’s next? Who’s the next big bad? In a series of posts (I don’t know how many there will be), I intend to answer the latter question by talking about one likely candidate: Kang the Conqueror. Due to the character’s complicated history, I will go over the different versions of Kang separately. After discussing each version, I will talk about how they could be used in the MCU to tie into not only the Avengers, but also the Fantastic Four and the X-Men as well. More under the cut.

For this first part of our Kang post series, we will be going over the earliest versions of the character due to how little these versions were used in the comics: Rama-Tut and Scarlet Centurion.

Born in the 31st Century, Nathaniel Richards was a scholar and possible descendant of Reed Richards who became fascinated by history and discovered time travel technology left behind by Doctor Doom. Using the technology and traveling in a Sphinx-shaped time ship, Nathaniel arrived in ancient Egypt and took control. He then took on the name Rama-Tut (pictured below) and sought to claim En Sabah Nur (Marvel fans out there will recognize this name-he is the first mutant ever born and destined to become Apocalypse) as his heir and the mutant’s power for himself. However, Rama-Tut’s reign was short-lived, as the Fantastic Four (who were displaced in that time period) ended up defeating him. Bitter at his defeat, Rama-Tut went forward in time to the modern era, where he met none other than Doctor Doom.

Rama-Tut:

Inspired by the Latverian dictator, Rama-Tut developed a new set of armor and weapons before taking on a new identity: the Scarlet Centurion.

Scarlet Centurion:


After assuming his new persona, Scarlet Centurion pits the Avengers against alternate reality counterparts of themselves. The battles go on until he tries to dispose of both Avengers teams as he originally planned. However, Scarlet Centurion is defeated by the combined Avengers’ night and is forced from the timeline.

MCU integration:

  • Nathaniel Richards could make his first film appearance as Rama-Tut in the post-credits scene of an MCU X-Men film that features Apocalypse as the villain. Following Apocalypse’s defeat, Rama-Tut can appear on the scene to try and get what he wants from the first mutant.
  • Carrying on from where the aforementioned hypothetical post-credits scene leaves off, Rama-Tut uses the Celestial technology of Apocalypse to expand his empire in the ancient past. Then, somehow, the Fantastic Four arrive in the time period by accident and encounter the false pharaoh. Rama-Tut will flee in his time ship at the end of the main story. The post-credits scene features Rama-Tut meeting Doctor Doom, followed by a shot of him building the Scarlet Centurion armor.
  • In the next big Avengers crossover film, Scarlet Centurion challenges the titular team in a time-hopping adventure that ends with his defeat once again. The post-credits scene features Kang trying to return to the 31st Century. However, Kang overshoots the time jump by nearly a thousand years and ends up going even further before ending up in the 40th century. In this war-torn era, humanity has devolved to barbarism, wielding advanced weaponry that they no longer understand by this point. Scarlet Centurion soon conquers this era easily, expanding his reach across the galaxy. The scene ends with a shot of Nathaniel Richards gazing upon the newly-invented Kang suit, and then subsequently renaming himself Kang the Conqueror.

Then, somehow, the Fantastic Four arrive in the time period by accident and encounter the false pharaoh. Rama-Tut will flee in his time ship at the end of the main story. The post-credits scene features Rama-Tut meeting Doctor Doom, followed by a shot of him building the Scarlet Centurion armor.
  • In the next big Avengers crossover film, Scarlet Centurion challenges the titular team in a time-hopping adventure that ends with his defeat once again. The post-credits scene features Kang trying to return to the 31st Century. However, Kang overshoots the time jump by nearly a thousand years and ends up going even further before ending up in the 40th century. In this war-torn era, humanity has devolved to barbarism, wielding advanced weaponry that they no longer understand by this point. Scarlet Centurion soon conquers this era easily, expanding his reach across the galaxy. The scene ends with a shot of Nathaniel Richards gazing upon the newly-invented Kang suit, and then subsequently renaming himself Kang the Conqueror.

trail.content_raw:
Next potential MCU big bad: Kang the Conqueror (Part 1)

WARNING: Some major Endgame spoilers ahead!

With Avengers: Endgame having been released, the movie draws the Infinity Saga to its conclusion in a fantastic close to the overarching storyline with the defeat of Thanos. Even though we know right now that Phase 3 officially ends with the release of Spider-Man: Far From Home this coming July, the questions on everyone’s minds are: What’s next? Who’s the next big bad? In a series of posts (I don’t know how many there will be), I intend to answer the latter question by talking about one likely candidate: Kang the Conqueror. Due to the character’s complicated history, I will go over the different versions of Kang separately. After discussing each version, I will talk about how they could be used in the MCU to tie into not only the Avengers, but also the Fantastic Four and the X-Men as well. More under the cut.

[[MORE]]

For this first part of our Kang post series, we will be going over the earliest versions of the character due to how little these versions were used in the comics: Rama-Tut and Scarlet Centurion.

Born in the 31st Century, Nathaniel Richards was a scholar and possible descendant of Reed Richards who became fascinated by history and discovered time travel technology left behind by Doctor Doom. Using the technology and traveling in a Sphinx-shaped time ship, Nathaniel arrived in ancient Egypt and took control. He then took on the name Rama-Tut (pictured below) and sought to claim En Sabah Nur (Marvel fans out there will recognize this name-he is the first mutant ever born and destined to become Apocalypse) as his heir and the mutant’s power for himself. However, Rama-Tut’s reign was short-lived, as the Fantastic Four (who were displaced in that time period) ended up defeating him. Bitter at his defeat, Rama-Tut went forward in time to the modern era, where he met none other than Doctor Doom.

Rama-Tut:

Inspired by the Latverian dictator, Rama-Tut developed a new set of armor and weapons before taking on a new identity: the Scarlet Centurion.

Scarlet Centurion:


After assuming his new persona, Scarlet Centurion pits the Avengers against alternate reality counterparts of themselves. The battles go on until he tries to dispose of both Avengers teams as he originally planned. However, Scarlet Centurion is defeated by the combined Avengers’ night and is forced from the timeline.

MCU integration:

  • Nathaniel Richards could make his first film appearance as Rama-Tut in the post-credits scene of an MCU X-Men film that features Apocalypse as the villain. Following Apocalypse’s defeat, Rama-Tut can appear on the scene to try and get what he wants from the first mutant.
  • Carrying on from where the aforementioned hypothetical post-credits scene leaves off, Rama-Tut uses the Celestial technology of Apocalypse to expand his empire in the ancient past. Then, somehow, the Fantastic Four arrive in the time period by accident and encounter the false pharaoh. Rama-Tut will flee in his time ship at the end of the main story. The post-credits scene features Rama-Tut meeting Doctor Doom, followed by a shot of him building the Scarlet Centurion armor.
  • In the next big Avengers crossover film, Scarlet Centurion challenges the titular team in a time-hopping adventure that ends with his defeat once again. The post-credits scene features Kang trying to return to the 31st Century. However, Kang overshoots the time jump by nearly a thousand years and ends up going even further before ending up in the 40th century. In this war-torn era, humanity has devolved to barbarism, wielding advanced weaponry that they no longer understand by this point. Scarlet Centurion soon conquers this era easily, expanding his reach across the galaxy. The scene ends with a shot of Nathaniel Richards gazing upon the newly-invented Kang suit, and then subsequently renaming himself Kang the Conqueror.
trail.content:
Next potential MCU big bad: Kang the Conqueror (Part 1)

WARNING: Some major Endgame spoilers ahead!

summary: A Bosszúállók: Végjáték már több, mint 2 milliárd dollárt kasszírozott össze
title: A Bosszúállók: Végjáték már több, mint 2 milliárd dollárt kasszírozott össze
body:
A mozik kasszái előtt megállíthatatlanok a Bosszúállók #Marvel #Bosszúállók #Végjáték #BoxOffice

Ahogy az várható volt, újabb mérföldkőhöz érkezett a Bosszúállók: Végjáték, ugyanis hétvégén bevétele elérte a 2 milliárd dollárt.

Szombatra a Bosszúállók: Végjátékgigantikus finálé összbevétele elérte a 2 milliárd dollárt világszerte, ezzel pedig minden idők leggyorsabb olyan mozifilmje lett, ami ilyen rövid idő alatt ekkora bevételre tett szert. A mostani rekordra mindösszesen 10 napra volt…

View On WordPress

blog.description: Hey! I'm Morgan, I'm 22, I watch movies and I write fanfiction! Prompts, Fic Requests and Ship Requests are now closed, sorry! @Bladam_Shevine on AO3

question: ❤️
answer:
Congratulations!

You have been adopted by Natasha Romanoff!

She’s a bad-ass single mother who would put her whole life on hold for you!

Send me a “❤️” and I’ll tell you who your Marvel parents are.

blog.name: lastloveklaroline
blog.title: Only Normal Crazy
blog.description: It's not a shame to love what you cannot explain.

summary: Same Clintasha anon... I'm screaming because I just found out that you have posted/reblogged content on like ALL of my major...
question: Same Clintasha anon... I'm screaming because I just found out that you have posted/reblogged content on like ALL of my major ships. I followed you for Klaroline way back in the day but I'm also huge on Clintasha, Reylo, and Gendrya with a splash of Dany x Jorah (don't know the ship name here). You have amazing taste omg!!!
answer: My thing is I just love chemistry and deep connections and whether it’s romantic or not I still root for it and love it in every way. Clintasha were very forefront in this last movie, for obvious reasons later, and I just wanted to pay homage to that because they really did wonderful with that relationship. I love so many ships it’s ridiculous lol.

I love so many ships it’s ridiculous lol.
